name: TMNT (Kevin Munroe, 2007) **1/2
reviewBody: I used to watch the cartoon series from the late 80s but skipped the live-action incarnations which sprung from it; this animated revival (using today’s technology) has, by all accounts, been received more favorably. It’s still basically a kiddie film – with an underlying moral about loyalty and integrity – but, at least, emerges to be equally entertaining for adults. The plot is pretty tepid and the situations hardly surprising (the best element being the vigilante figure of the “Night Watcher”); also, only two of the Turtles (Leonardo and Raphael) get decent mileage here – and that’s due to their antagonism! While the Turtles’ arch-nemesis – Shredder – is missing here, we’re left with the promise of a sequel in which an enemy from their past will return...
